page.title: 07HEALTH: CARE OF THE ELDERLY
page.content: A District Nurse will visit people in their own homes if necessary for minor medical treatment such as dressings, injections or help with getting up or being put to bed. Visits can also be arranged for a chiropodist. There is a 'Meals-on-wheels' Service in Bromyard for meals to be taken to pensioners in their own homes if thought beneficial. On the outskirts of Bromyard there is a Geriatric Hospital under the National Health Service, and at Tedstone Court, a large Georgian House in the area 8 elderly people are cared for privately with a staff of a fulltime State Enrolled Nurses with assistance from local farmers' wives and cottagers. A Doctor calls once a week. As may be seen old folk are well cared for in the area, and it is agreed that the good neighbourliness here is good.
